column5: Your stronger than me Pete!! Keep atter bud!! I gotta kick this nasty habit too!!  S.

Great job bud.Its been 4 or5 years for me.As long as you know that lighting up one time will be one of the greatest dissapointments of your life you will be fine.The only way you will start again is if you light one up. Joe

You know what the worst is a couple of times a year Ill go buy a nice 8" Cohiba go sit down by the lake I have resided to the fact I will not be able to do this ..I guess I could go sniff a box  Peter

Stick with it Peter. If you ever need any encouragement, there are plenty of us on here that have gone through it and would be happy to chat a while...  As for finding a box to sniff......well, you're on your own there.......

I HAVE GOT TO SHARE THIS  My name is PETER , and I am a nicotine addict. I have stopped nicotine for 1 month, 19 hours, 8 minutes and 28 seconds (31 days).  I've not smoked 954 death sticks, and saved $364.88. I've saved 3 days, 7 hours and 29 minutes of my life.  YEAH BABY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Good for you Peter.  I'm still trying to get the butts out of my life!
Great job man, I gave it up 16 months ago and never even give it a thought anymore.  It gets easier every day.
Well done. You are squarely on your way.  You should be noticing an increase of appetite by now
Good job, Peter!  Keep updating us!!!
Keep it up! I quit smoking 7 years ago TODAY!!!

Right on Pete !! Soon you'll be able to taste food again and don't forget to exercise to give yourself some distraction and boost your metabolism at the same time....Might as well go for the gusto !!!  Good Luck
good for you Peter Im no officially a non for 761 days I havent inhaled on 30,440 lung darts and have saved a total of $10,958  thanks for making me think about this..good luck
Now that's a death defying act right there.  Congratulations, Peter.  I've heard that it takes most of us 5 tries before we actually succeed at kicking the habit.
definite congrats....and to the rest of you as well

It took me a mass coronary. When I came around I was told I could quit now or I would be back on the slab next month. That was 9 years and 8 months back.  I do enjoy reading that others have found the means to quit without enduring severe consequences first.
Way to go!  Seventeen months now for me.
Good for you, Stick with it, you'll make it. Now just think, the money you save you can buy a, New boat, Truck, etc. And live longer to enjoy
Just don't spend the savings on Whiskey !!  Congrats fella.. what's it feel like to get a full breath of air...
That's great! No more missed fish that hit while you're lightin'-up.
great job! keep at it, man!!!
Good job. 14 months for me. It seems to get easier as time goes by. More time fishing and less time smoking!!! Its all in your head.....Stick with it, no matter how hard it is

good job! i quit 2 years ago and it was the best decision i ever made.  i had only smoked for 15 years and it was exceptionally difficult to do.  i don't know how some of you lifers quit but it's awesome to see.

Good for you, keep it up!!!! I have been smoke free for 4036 days now and have not smoked more than 100,000 butts!!!!! I don't know what that comes out to money wise but it is probably enough to buy a good new car!!!! I know up here the cost of smokes is insane!!! At $15 a pack it would save me $61,000 over that time!!!!

Cigarette companies are kinda evil. Taking your money and knowingly, slowly killing you.  Stopped buying them in May 2008 and know i will never smoke a cigarette again. It is easier once you do other things like drinking water or eating decent snacks etc...  Keep it up Peter.

Good for you Peter, I started on Champix this past Friday this will be my second go round on Champix I hope it sticks this time.  Just a word of advice don`t let your guard down I can`t count how many times I have quit for 2 or 3 months only to relapse. The last quit was with Champix and I was off cigs for about 4 months and one day driving home from work I had an uncontrollable urge for a cig and that was it I was done. Keep up the good work.
I quite two years ago on Champix. Keep it up.
Good for you.I did it once and got back into the habit.I wish I never started back up.Good for you.I just hope youre not a nervous wreck over it.I was for sure.
You're doing great Peter    Keep it up
THANKS ALL GOOD CROWD TO SHARE WITH
